greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Transpose of square array A276586.
comment: Rows give the successive first differences of A136104.
link: Index entries for sequences related to primorial numbers
example: The top left corner of the array:
program: (Scheme) (define (A276587 n) (A276586bi (A025581 n) (A002262 n))) ;; Code for A276586bi given in A276586.
T(n, k) = sum(j=0, n, binomial(n, j)*P(k + j));
for(n=0, 10, for(k=0, n, print1(T(n - k, k),", ");); print();) \\ _Indranil Ghosh_, Apr 11 2017
xref: Topmost row: A136104. For other rows and columns, see the information given in transpose A276586.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 18 2016
